intro: Quarena indica, commonly known as the Indian quarena, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Quarena indica is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
